meanings.definition: Capable of being lapsed or allowed to lapse.
meanings.sent1: The subscription was lapsable, so I didn't renew it.
meanings.sent2: Her attention to detail was lapsable, leading to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The lapsable warranty left him in a tricky situation.
meanings.sent4: His lapsable commitment to exercise wavered like a flickering candle.
meanings.sent5: The lapsable bridge swayed in the wind, threatening to collapse.

meanings.definition: Subject to lapsing or falling into a lapse.
meanings.sent1: The lapsable contract needed constant monitoring.
meanings.sent2: His lapsable memory caused him to forget important dates.
meanings.sent3: The lapsable internet connection made online gaming frustrating.
meanings.sent4: Her lapsable focus on the task resulted in unfinished work.
meanings.sent5: The lapsable roof leaked whenever it rained, causing inconvenience.
